sentence: Rep. Reginald Bolding, D-Laveen, said it isn't that simple.
author: Howard Fischer Capitol Media Services
title: House panel votes 6-4 to restrict racism lessons in Arizona schools

sentence: House Minority Leader Reginald Bolding, D-Phoenix, predicted that if his Republican colleagues got the power to reject election results, they’d do so based simply on which results they liked or didn’t like.
author: Jeremy Duda
title: Newest Arizona GOP election proposal would allow lawmakers to reject election results

author: Jeremy Duda
title: New 'terrifying' GOP proposal in Arizona would allow lawmakers to reject election results

sentence: "This bill is probably one of the biggest threats that we have seen here to our democracy," Arizona House Minority Leader Reginald Bolding, a Democrat, said in an interview with Salon.
title: Arizona bills embrace Trump conspiracy theories — could allow GOP to reject election results

title: AZ Republicans Introduce Bill Allowing Legislature to “Reject” Election Results
